title: Context Engineering 101 - The Simple Strategy to 100x AI Coding
description:
Context Engineering is the new big thing for AI coding - not because the concept is new, but because we're finally reaching the point where everyone realizes that putting in the effort to provide extensive, engineered context to AI coding assistants is what separates real results from vibe coding. 

Most people are still playing around with these ideas without a true systematic process, so I'm about to show you how to actually implement context engineering for real production builds with a strategy called PRPs (Product Requirements Prompts).

Understanding the idea is one thing - watching it demolish a non-trivial project from start to finish is something completely different. And that's exactly what we're doing today. I'm taking everything from my previous context engineering video and putting it into practice by building a production-ready MCP server from scratch. No shortcuts, no simple demos - we're talking about real code that follows security best practices, handles errors properly, and ships to production.
